bibl.title: Memphite Palaeography: Some Observations on Texts from the Ptolemaic Period.
bibl.note: Concentrates primarily on the legal papyri, mostly from the Choachytes' and God's Seal-Bearers' archives, found in the Memphite necropolis and spread across the whole Ptolemaic period. - Excursus 1: The writing of Ptḥ/Gb. - Excursus 2: How scribal hands can vary within one location. - Appendix: Papyri discussed.

bibl.title: Aspects of Demotic Lexicography. Acts of an International Colloquium held in Trier, 8 November 2010

bibl.seg: Cary J. Martin, Memphite Palaeography: Some Observations on Texts from the Ptolemaic Period.
S.P. Vleeming (ed.), Aspects of Demotic Lexicography. Acts of an International Colloquium held in Trier, 8 November 2010 = Studia Demotica. 11 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2013) pp. 41-62.

Concentrates primarily on the legal papyri, mostly from the Choachytes' and God's Seal-Bearers' archives, found in the Memphite necropolis and spread across the whole Ptolemaic period. - Excursus 1: The writing of Ptḥ/Gb. - Excursus 2: How scribal hands can vary within one location. - Appendix: Papyri discussed.
